projects.name: Capital Assistance Project
projects.description: Co-runs the project which pairs law student interns with legal aid organizations seeking to overturn the death penalty.

projects.name: Portrait Project 2.0
projects.description: Collaborates with California Supreme Court Justice Goodwin Liu on an empirical study into Asian American representation in law and politics.

projects.name: COVID-19 Relief Initiative
projects.description: Worked on an initiative to ensure COVID-19 relief checks remained in the hands of incarcerated individuals during an internship at the Georgia Justice Project in Atlanta.

publications.title: A Portrait of Asian Americans in the Law 2.0: Identity and Action in Challenging Times
publications.authors: Hon. Goodwin Liu, Tyler Dang, Katherine Fang, Michael Tayag
publications.summary: This report provides an updated analysis of Asian American representation and experiences in the legal profession, focusing on identity issues and responses to recent challenges faced by the community.
publications.snippet: The study examines trends in Asian American participation in various sectors of the legal field, including law firms, judiciary, and public service. It also explores how recent social and political events have impacted Asian American lawyers' professional experiences and community engagement.

publications.title: Portrait Project 2.0 Policy Brief: Identity and Action in Challenging Times
publications.authors: Tyler Dang, Katherine Fang, Benji Lu, Hon. Goodwin Liu, Michael Tayag
publications.summary: This policy brief presents key findings and recommendations from the Portrait Project 2.0 study on Asian Americans in the legal profession.
publications.snippet: The brief highlights critical issues facing Asian American lawyers, including representation disparities, career advancement challenges, and the impact of recent anti-Asian sentiment. It offers policy recommendations for law schools, legal employers, and professional organizations to address these concerns.

awards.name: Paul & Daisy Soros Fellowship for New Americans
awards.description: Merit-based fellowship for immigrants and children of immigrants in the United States, providing up to $90,000 in funding for graduate education.

awards.name: Fulbright Scholarship
awards.description: Awarded to teach English and work on refugee policy in Jordan.

awards.name: Kerry Initiative Fellowship
awards.description: Supported Secretary John Kerry in researching and organizing conferences on pressing international challenges.

experience.description: Assisted in machine learning research projects under the supervision of faculty members.
Developed and maintained web applications using React and Node.js.

projects.name: AI-Powered Chess Engine
projects.description: Developed a chess engine using deep learning techniques to predict optimal moves and evaluate board positions.
projects.summary: This project implements an AI-powered chess engine that utilizes deep learning algorithms to analyze chess positions and suggest optimal moves. The engine employs convolutional neural networks trained on a large dataset of professional chess games to evaluate board states and predict the best possible moves.

projects.name: Sustainable Energy Tracker
projects.description: Created a web application to track and visualize renewable energy usage across different regions.
projects.summary: The Sustainable Energy Tracker is a web-based platform that allows users to monitor and analyze renewable energy consumption patterns across various geographical areas. It features interactive visualizations and real-time data updates to promote awareness and encourage sustainable energy practices.

research.title: Explainable AI in Healthcare Decision Making
research.summary: This research explores the application of explainable AI techniques in healthcare decision-making processes. It focuses on developing interpretable machine learning models that can assist medical professionals in diagnosis and treatment planning while providing clear explanations for their predictions.
research.snippet: In this study, we propose a novel approach to integrate explainable AI methods into clinical decision support systems. Our framework combines state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms with domain-specific knowledge to generate human-readable explanations for AI-driven medical recommendations. The results demonstrate improved trust and adoption of AI systems among healthcare practitioners.

publications.title: Towards Interpretable Deep Learning Models for Medical Diagnosis
publications.authors: Fan, J., Smith, A., Johnson, B.
publications.journal: Journal of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine
publications.summary: This paper presents a novel approach to creating interpretable deep learning models for medical diagnosis. The proposed method combines attention mechanisms with layer-wise relevance propagation to provide clear explanations for model predictions in various medical imaging tasks.
publications.snippet: We introduce a hybrid architecture that leverages the power of convolutional neural networks and transformer models to analyze medical images. Our approach not only achieves state-of-the-art accuracy in diagnosing various conditions but also generates heat maps and textual explanations to highlight the regions and features that contributed most to the model's decision.

education.degree: Masters in Management Science and Engineering

research.title: Algebraic Geometry and Number Theory
research.description: Focusing on the intersection of algebraic geometry and number theory, particularly in the study of arithmetic properties of algebraic varieties.

publications.title: On the Arithmetic of Certain Modular Curves
publications.summary: This paper explores the arithmetic properties of specific modular curves, providing new insights into their structure and behavior. The research contributes to our understanding of the interplay between geometry and number theory in these mathematical objects.
publications.snippet: We investigate the arithmetic of X_0(N) for certain values of N, focusing on the distribution of rational points and their relation to modular forms. Our main result establishes a novel connection between the j-invariants of these points and certain arithmetic progressions, shedding light on the deep structure of these curves.

projects.title: Computational Methods in Algebraic Number Theory
projects.description: Developed algorithms for efficient computation of class groups and unit groups in number fields.
projects.summary: This project focused on implementing and optimizing algorithms for fundamental computations in algebraic number theory. The work resulted in significant improvements in the speed and efficiency of calculating class groups and unit groups for high-degree number fields.
